## JsonPointer.get() method

Retrieves a value from an object using a JSON Pointer.

**Signature:**

```typescript
static get<T extends object, P extends PointerPaths<T>>(object: T, pointer?: P): ResolveJsonPointer<T, P>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

object


</td><td>

T


</td><td>

The source object to get value from


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

pointer


</td><td>

P


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ JSON Pointer string (e.g., "/path/to/value")


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

[ResolveJsonPointer](./format.resolvejsonpointer.md)<!-- -->&lt;T, P&gt;

The value at the specified path or undefined if path doesn't exist

## Example


```typescript
const obj = { foo: { bar: [1, 2, 3] } };
JsonPointer.get(obj, "/foo/bar/0"); // returns 1
JsonPointer.get(obj, "/foo/bar"); // returns [1, 2, 3]
JsonPointer.get(obj, ""); // returns the entire object
```
